subject: Fix building for x86_64 Change fixed lib path to a architecture dependent.
commitMessage:
Fix building for x86_64
Change fixed lib path to a architecture dependent.

Bug on Tizen-Jira: TC-357

Change-Id: I15f62f9fc3e183acc21fd5dc7e64feb09c867fdc
Signed-off-by: Radoslaw Bartosiak <r.bartosiak@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thank you. Please verify.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Builds successfully for ARMv7l, i586 and x86_64 architecture.

Patch Set 1:

Merge and gbs submit is needed. Thx.

Patch Set 1:

See TC-357: given that the multiuser patch dfc202c3a42f93e7916014a876610a605241e863 (review #16227) breaks the build and that this patch is based on it, I doubt that everything builds fine.

The multiuser patch must be updated to fix the build before applying this one.

Patch Set 1:

Build brakes, that is true but this patch is not the problem.
There is some problem with paths generated by gbs. There is macro TZ_SYS_DB which value is 'usr' or 'opt' - depends on architecture used.Build fails during installation step when tries to copy file '.privilegelist.db'. I fails even without this patch.
This must be fixed of course but this commit is ok.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Validated but never merged. Who to do it ?

The change could not be merged due to a path conflict.

Please rebase the change locally and upload the rebased commit for review.
